abstract.para: The Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) are the configuration standards for U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) Information Assurance (IA) and IA-enabled devices/systems. The guides are maintained and published by the Defense Information Systems Agencyâ€™s (DISA) Field Security Office (FSO).
Note that the SRRs have been deprecated by DISA.

para.literallayout: 709 Total number of line items in guideline 275 Items at least partially addressed by OS Lockdown 434 Items not addressed by OS Lockdown

row.entry: The /etc/security/access.conf file must be owned by root.
The /etc/security/access.conf file must have a privileged group owner.
The /etc/security/access.conf file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.
Single User Mode Password Incompatibility Documentation
Single User Mode Password Incompatibility Location

member.xref: Lock account after three failed login attempts
SSHD Set Idle Timeout Interval for User Logins
Set X Screen Saver Application Defaults
Set Password Aging on Active Accounts
Set Password Aging on Active Accounts
Root shell must be on / filesystem

row.entry: System Files, Programs, and Directories Ownership
System Files, Programs, and Directories Group Ownership
The /etc/resolv.conf file must be owned by root.
The /etc/resolv.conf file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
The /etc/resolv.conf file must have mode 0644 or less permissive.
The /etc/hosts file must be owned by root.
The /etc/hosts file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
The /etc/hosts file must have mode 0644 or less permissive.
The /etc/nsswitch.conf file must be owned by root.

member.xref: Name Service Switch Configuration File Permissions

row.entry: The /etc/nsswitch.conf file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.

member.xref: Name Service Switch Configuration File Permissions

row.entry: The /etc/nsswitch.conf file must have mode 0644 or less permissive.

member.xref: Name Service Switch Configuration File Permissions

row.entry: The /etc/passwd file must not contain password hashes.

member.xref: No Hashes Allowed in Passwd/Group Files

row.entry: The /etc/group file must not contain any group password hashes.

member.xref: No Hashes Allowed in Passwd/Group Files
Correct System RC Script PATH Variables

row.entry: Run Control Scripts World Writable Programs or Scripts
Global Initialization Files do not Contain mesg -n
All skeleton files (typically in /etc/skel) must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, system, or other.

member.xref: Correct Global Init Script PATH Variables

row.entry: Local Initialization Files World Writable Programs or Scripts

member.xref: No Plus Entries in Password Files

row.entry: System Baseline for SUID Files Checking

member.xref: Use NOSUID and NODEV for Removable Media

row.entry: System Baseline for SGID Files Checking
Audit Failed File and Program Access Attempts
Audit Administrative, Privileged, and Security Actions
Audit Login, Logout, and Session Initiation
Audit Discretionary Access Control Permission Modifications
Cron Executes Programs in World Writable Directories
Crontab files must be group-owned by root, cron, or the crontab creator's primary group.
Cron and Crontab Directories Group Ownership
At Executes Programs in World Writable Directories
The "at" directory must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or cron.
Kernel core dumps must be disabled unless needed.
Core Dump Directory Ownership and Permissions
The kernel core dump data directory must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
The kernel core dump data directory must have mode 0700 or less permissive.

member.xref: Ignore ICMP ECHO and TIMESTAMP Requests

row.entry: Proxy ARP must not be enabled on the system.

member.xref: Disable Proxy Address Resolution Protocol (Proxy ARP)

row.entry: The inetd.conf file, xinetd.conf file, and the xinetd.d directory must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
The xinetd.d directory must have mode 0755 or less permissive.
The services file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
Remote Login or Shell Is Enabled
The hosts.lpd (or equivalent) file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.

member.xref: Restrict Use of Traceroute and Ping
Restrict Use of Traceroute and Ping
Restrict Use of Traceroute and Ping

row.entry: Browser Secure and Non-secure Content Warning
FTP or Telnet Userids and Passwords
The ftpusers file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
X Window System Not Required and Not Disabled

member.xref: Disable SNMP if default public string exists

row.entry: The snmpd.conf file must be group-owned by root, sys, bin, or system.
The /etc/syslog.conf file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.
Squid Web Proxy Authentication Header Vulnerability
Squid Web Proxy MSNT Auth Helper Vulnerability
The NFS export configuration file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.
Deny NFS Client Access Without Userid

member.xref: Deny NFS Client Access Without UID or GID

row.entry: Public Instant Messaging Client is Installed
If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must have mode 0644 or less permissive.
If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must be owned by root.
If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.

member.xref: Remove Insecure_Locks option for NFS Server
Use NOSUID and NODEV for Removable Media
